TI_TEXT.P: Εξοπλισμός ασφαλείας (π.χ. έναντι κλοπής, πυρκαγιάς κ.λπ.)

ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: The State Hospitals Board for Scotland

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: The State Hospitals Board for Scotland

TITLE.P: The State Hospitals Board for Scotland Perimeter Security and Enhanced Internal Security Systems 2017

SHORT_DESCR.P: The replacement, refresh, upgrading and enhancement of security systems at The State Hospital.

It is intended to refresh and enhance security systems at The State Hospital. The Hospital is fitted with a suite of integrated security measures which are to be renewed, refreshed and enhanced. The security project will take place against a background of continued operations and is to cause minimum disruption to patients, staff and visitors, whilst retaining current levels of security during works.

Tenderers should be aware that significant experience will be required to enable safe delivery of the project. Sector experience and successful delivery of projects thereof will be closely assessed for interested parties. Experience in successful delivery of complex integrated security systems set in Core National Infrastructure (CNI), High Secure Hospital, Category A prison, Government or Military settings in the United Kingdom or a compatible EU establishment will be a prerequisite for applicants.
Applied standards will be UK derived British Standards and CE EU standards.

The following questions form part of the hospitals selection process and require bidders to be very concise and clear about the role they played in the projects used as examples. The hospital will be contacting the client identified in your response.

Part 2 of the ITT has the main body of the tender and it is the responsibility of the bidders having responded to the selection questions to evaluate if they feel it appropriate to move onto part 2 and complete the main response.
Selection Questions and can be found in part 2 of the ITT and on the Public Contracts Scotland — Tender Site.
Tell us about your previous work within Core National Infrastructure and work within an organisation that is live 24 hour 365 days per year.

Has your organisation undertaken work as the principal security integrator in a CNI (Critical National Infrastructure) secure site (e.g. nuclear, petroleum, government, military, prison, high secure hospital) that was fully functioning 24 hours per day 365 days per year in the last 5 years (Please provide relevant examples).
Intergration of systems and Equipment.
Has your organisation delivered a successful project in an live environment listed above in which:
Access to site, control of tools and the requirement to be constantly escorted were present.
Has your organisation delivered a successful project where the requirement for constant availability of security systems were a feature of the project.
Has your organisation delivered a successful project where the volatility of site operations could significantly impact on the project and vice versa.
Tell us about the achievements and the time cost and quality targets both you and the client set including any gaps in meeting expectations.

Has your organisation and the employees named within your submission, experience of using the NEC3 form of Contract to deliver the projects named above within the last 5 years? (Please provide examples).
Note.

The Hospital has a clear strategy going forward with this project of re-use, upgrade and replacement of systems or part systems, one of the main re-use element of this project is the Security Management System (SMS) (Cortech Datalog 5).

As part of the hospitals strategy to re-use, upgrade and replacement Equipment and Systems, a clear decision to re-use our recently upgraded Cortech Datalog 5 system has been made. The following questions relate to the this type of security management system and your previous work. Your responses must be when your work was as the principle Security Integrator, and in relation to the responses in the above questions.
Selection Question.
If you have used Security Management System (SMS) (Cortech Datalog 5) please tell us your experience of this when used as part of the project mentioned in the responses to the above questions.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: Costing on Ongoing Maintenance of equipment.

INFO_ADD.P: Financial information.
The Financial information requested within the ESPD should be based on the Last complete 3 years.
Employer's (Compulsory) Liability Insurance — 10 000 000 GBP.
Public Liability Insurance — 10 000 000 GBP.
Product Liability Insurance — 10 000 000 GBP.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: The State Hospital want to ensure that fair and equal treatment is provided to all suppliers however the equipment outlay in this contract maybe substantial. Bidders will need to demonstrate though their submission that they have the capacity and good financial standing to complete this contract.

The ESPD questions relating to Financial accounts should be responded to using 3 years information. If 3 years is not available (due to start up) provide as much information as possible and information on how we can test your firms financial ability to preform this contract.
The State Hospital will be using a Project Bank Account for this project and details of this will be provided in the tender documents on Public Contracts Scotland — Tender.

PERFORMANCE_CONDITIONS.P: This contract will be subject to regular review meeting throughout the process of the contract and monitored by both the State Hospital Project team and that of our professional advisors.

INFO_ADD.P: Bidders are welcome to witness the opening of tenders. Prior appointment will be required.

Bidders should note that when it is judged by The State Hospital (at their sole discretion) to be appropriate the hospital will collaborate with other relevant bodies for the benefit of evaluating your response.
The bidders shall ensure all relevant certificates, insurances etc., are up to date.
Management Information will be required on a monthly basis including reporting on Community Benefits.
Once notification is received the following documentation will be required:
Evidence of your company's insurance certification detailing the required level of insurance as per the levels stated within the contract notice.
Insurances and any other documentation required.
Tenderers are advised to allow adequate time for uploading documents and dispatch the electronic tender well in advance of the closing time to avoid any last minute problems.
A summary of the expected community benefits has been provided as follows:

The State Hospitals Board for Scotland is committed to maximising community benefit from its procurement activities. Under this procurement, the supplier and its supply chain will be required to actively participate in the achievement of the authorities' social and economic objectives. Accordingly, contract performance conditions may relate in particular to social, economic and environmental considerations.
Financial information.
The Financial information requested within the ESPD should be based on the Last complete 3 years.
Employer's (Compulsory) Liability Insurance — 10 000 000 GBP.
Public Liability Insurance — 10 000 000 GBP.
Product Liability Insurance — 10 000 000 GBP.
The buyer is using PCS-Tender to conduct this ITT exercise. The Project code is 10026. For more information see: http://www.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk/info/InfoCentre.aspx?ID=2343.
A sub-contract clause has been included in this contract. For more information see: http://www.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk/info/InfoCentre.aspx?ID=2363.
Community benefits are included in this requirement. For more information see: http://www.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk/info/InfoCentre.aspx?ID=2361.
A summary of the expected community benefits has been provided as follows:

The State Hospital is keen to ensure the contractors we engage with also engage with the community. The evaluation panel will be taking a particular interest in the community benefits in your submission. Please if possible link your responses to the values of the State Hospital remembering that the hospital cares for adult males in Scotland and Northern Ireland suffering from mental health. We fully understand that our service is specialised however linking any mental health community benefit will be of particular interest to the panel.
